Articles.Content:
Welcome to James Orbit

jamesorbit.webs.com

James Orbit started in early 2012, when James Air (The main company) decided it needed to extend. First, James Rail came. Then some other boring stuff. Last of all, The James Orbit Space Team was created.

J.O.S.T Was set up to allow James Air to reach new heights. Not only do they control all of the James Air space missions, but also carry out most of the research needed to run James Air.

Our goal is to bring affordable space travel to all kerbals that don\'t want to be killed!

We pride our selfs in being one of the most reliable Space organizations in the world. We never launch until we know it is safe (Well, maybe not always, but we try our best! ;D ).

missions:

Newton 7 : Not in use (To book, E-mail J.O.S.T at [email protected], With the subject: Newton 7)

Newton 11 : Not in use (To book, E-mail J.O.S.T at [email protected], With the subject: Newton 11)

Expedition : Tests in progress (To find out more, E-mail J.O.S.T at [email protected], With the subject: Expedition)

Commissions: (please go to our website to commission what ever you want!)

Current commissions:

Deep space Badger: due to leave the kerbal system in 63 years

Expedition:

James Orbits New Mission is called Expedition. This is because we plan to find and explore new places all over the kerbalverse.

To do this, J.O.S.T Made plans for a new spacecraft.

During tests we took some pictures:

Newton:

Newton is a set of small space labs/stations set up to allow cheap stays in space.

Newton 7 was set up to allow scientists to conduct experiments in micro gravity.

Newton 11 is identical to Newton 7, but is intended as more of a tourist hotel.

Britannia 2:

Britannia 2 is a very small reusable craft that can take 1 person into a Low Kerbin Orbit. in extreme cases Britannia craft can land on the mun with half a tank to spare once its returned.

More coming soon

Edited August 7, 2012 by N3X15
Oooh god, the competition has arrived xD

Oooh god, the competition has arrived xD

J.O.S.T is pleased to announce the Newton Project. Two space labs/stations, to allow cheap stays in space.

Oh come on, thats just...

Wait, whats this in my orbit! Its the MK1 Spytech space hotel!

Open me ->

J.O.S.T is pleased to announce the Newton Project. Two space labs/stations, to allow cheap stays in space.

That gives me an idea.

Spytech is pleased to announce the fATOM Project. Several large orbital labs will be constructed, to make for over-budgeted stays in space.

J.O.S.T is now preparing Newton 15. Newton 15 will actually be two newton stations together to form a space hotel. Whats more, the hotel will move into lunar orbit! 8)

Newton 15 will also act as a control center for Hawkinge crater.

Shenzou/Tiangong, anyone?

â€¦Anyways, I love your designs. You\'re sure going to have a heck of a time once docking comes out, or at least once crew transfer comes out in 0.16.
It is based on this: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CSTS
can i send a inpact probe on newton 7 to impact into minmus?

It is based on this: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CSTS

Ah. You can clearly see the russian influence in that design. Also seems as if the service/orbital modules are based off the ATV.
I agree. J.O.S.T will be making one similar design as part of the Expedition mun station project (planned to be in Hawking crater) and to help as part of the Newton project.
J.O.S.T is now asking what you think James Orbit should do next. Once a new development path has been chosen, we will be looking for partners.
Does anyone know how to get rid of a poll?

Does anyone know how to get rid of a poll?

If you click edit poll (pencil icon), at the bottom in miscellaneous options there should be a close poll option.
I don't see a pencil icon, What is it at the bottom of?

I don't see a pencil icon, What is it at the bottom of?

It looks like at the moment there is no way of removing a poll from a thread completely but I will look into it for you.
